channel.title: Some help
channel.description:
How exactly do i make a .cfg file readable from a jar file?
Whenever i try to open the jar, it doesnt open, when i use a batch to open it for debugging and i can see the errors, it says it cannot find my config file, checked it, and its in there, are .cfg files unreadable from a jar? If so, heres what ive thought i can do...
1. Remodify the config class so its not read from a .cfg file, but the config class itself
2. Make the file readable (somehow)
Can someone help me out on this? Im puzzled why it cannot be read in the jar file...
This is an Hyperion client, i got caught up and saw i posted in the wrong section, mod please by nice enough to move please :D

item.title: Some help
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:20, topic:382675”][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=478467.msg3502443#msg3502443 date=1297833906]

nevermind.
it’s just not able to find that file. make sure it’s in the right directory

Well im sure its in the correct directory, because i set an exception for it in the jarmaker, and its also supposed to be in the same place as the class files, in the main directory of the client.
[/quote]um, okay? is your client class able to get to the cfg file. it doesn’t need to be in the same directory as client.java, it needs to be in the same directory as client.class…

yeah, actually it is, the same way it was in the client.[/quote]
no it’s fucking not because it clearly says it cannot find it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Liquid Magic, post:15, topic:382675”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=478467.msg3502431#msg3502431 date=1297832955]

it seems to me the file is being executed but your program is missing a necessary file…

no, i checked, every single file is in the jar, as of the client.
[/quote]i don’t think you know what you’re talking about. can you post a screenshot of the terminal saying whatever it said when you executed it?[/quote]

After taking a look at this again, i’ll take a look at line 184 of the client… maybe i need to add another kind of exception in the jarmaker? or manifest template…

Oh, its just the code leading to the config file i was talking about, i guess saying it cant process that piece of code, or something? Correct me if im wrong.

BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config.cfg"));

Read full topic

item.title: Some help
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“The Tormented, post:5, topic:382675”]im not quite sure what you asking here,

if your asking how to open a jar file to read from it, open it in winrar

The Tormented[/quote]
That is not what i am asking.

I know, you open it in winrar, im saying when i try to open the executable jar file via java se, i cant, so i used the command prompt to open it using a batch as a debug console, so i can see whats wrong, and it cant find the config.cfg file, were the servers common name (Lets say i name the server drubrkletern, so the common name would be, in places like the loading screen, it would say “Drubrkletern is loading, please wait” and “Welcome to Drubrkletern, enter your username and password” Its just a fast way to change things without a need for using javac to make changes to the class file) it also controls the internet protocol address it uses to enter the server, (e.g localhost, (namehere).no-ip.biz, etc.) and the port used to forward players to your server.

So im thinking it cannot be read in a jar file, so refer to my first post for more details on this.

Read full topic
